Uses of Class
eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.exception.DeviceException

  • Packages that use DeviceException 
    Package Description
    eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.device
    Contains classes used with and by JDroidLib to represent devices, their components and utilities that don't make sense in any other package.
    eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.device.fs
    Contains classes used for representing parts of an Android Device's file system.
    eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.exception
    Contains exceptions thrown by JDroidLibv2.
    eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.interfaces
    Contains interfaces used internally by the JDroidLib library.

    • Uses of DeviceException in eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.exception

      Subclasses of DeviceException in eu.casoftworks.jdroidlib.exception 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CannotRemoveException
      Device-class exception that is thrown when a file or directory cannot be removed from the host Device.
      class  CannotTouchException
      Device-class exception that can be thrown when a file cannot be touched on an Android Device.
      class  DeviceNotConnectedViaTcpIpException
      Exception that can be thrown when a device was expected to be connected to the host via TCP/IP, but wasn't.
      class  FileAlreadyExistsException
      Device-class exception that is thrown when a file or directory already exists on the Device's file system, when expected otherwise.
      class  FileCouldNotBePulledException
      Device-class exception that may be thrown when a pull (file or folder) attempt fails.
      class  FileCouldNotBePushedException
      Device-class exception that is thrown when a file or directory could not be pushed to a Device
      class  IllegalDeviceStateException
      Exception thrown when a targeted device is in an unexpected state.
